com.fluidops.fedx.structures
Class Endpoint

java.lang.Object
  com.fluidops.fedx.structures.Endpoint

public class Endpoint
extends java.lang.Object

Structure to maintain endpoint information, e.g. type, location, etc. For initialization the underlying repository must be set using #setRepo(Repository, TripleSource, boolean).

All endpoints need to be added to the EndpointManager, moreover endpoints can be looked up using their id and their connection.

An endpoint uses a Singleton for the repository connection. If by chance this connection is broken, e.g. due to a SocketException, a call to repairConnection() reinitializes the connection.

Note: Interaction with endpoints should be done via the EndpointManager

Author:
Andreas Schwarte
See Also:
EndpointManager

public Endpoint(java.lang.String id,

                java.lang.String endpoint,
                Endpoint.EndpointType type,
                Endpoint.EndpointClassification endpointClassification)
Construct a new endpoint.

Parameters:
id - the globally unique identifier, e.g. SPARQL_dbpedia351
name - the name of this endpoint
endpoint - the endpoint, e.g. for SPARQL the URL
type - the type, e.g. SPARQL, NativeStore
